commentary.text: It's Gambhir and Uthappa to open for Kolkata as they begin their pursuit of 149. Kolkata used spin for all six overs of the powerplay, but Chennai aren't following their lead. It's going to be Ben Hilfenhaus to bowl the first over.
Hilfenhaus to Uthappa,no run,Bit of outswing and Uthappa is beaten as he pokes outside off stump without moving his feet.
Hilfenhaus to Uthappa,no run,shapes away again, straighter, defended down the ground.
Hilfenhaus to Uthappa,1 run,angled into leg stump, prodded down to mid-on.
Gambhir scratches out a middle-stump guard.
Hilfenhaus to Gambhir,no run,angled across, Gambhir jumps and squirts it down defensively.
Hilfenhaus to Gambhir,(no ball) 1 run,full toss at shoulder height, Gambhir somehow slaps it wide of point.
Hilfenhaus to Uthappa,no run,lovely ball, swings away from back of a length, and Uthappa is beaten once more. No footwork once again.
Hilfenhaus to Uthappa,no run,Short, swings away, Uthappa nowhere near it as he tries to pull.
Ishwar Pandey from the other end. No spin yet for Chennai.
Pandey to Gambhir,no run,Back of a length, Gambhir can't time it cleanly as he tries to pull.
Pandey to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,Short, wide, slashed away over the point region.
Pandey to Gambhir,1 leg bye,curls in off a fuller length, hits Gambhir on the pads as he tries to flick.
Pandey to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,Full, wide, leans forward to drive crisply through the covers.
Pandey to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,super shot. angles into Uthappa, and he leans forward and twirls his wrists delightfully to beat mid on.
Pandey to Uthappa,no run,back of a length, defended down the pitch.
Hilfenhaus to continue.
Hilfenhaus to Gambhir,1 run,Back of a length, Gambhir wrists it down into the leg side, on the hop.

Hilfenhaus to Uthappa, $$OUT$$ ,run out! Uthappa takes two steps down and inside-edges as he tries to swat across the line. Gambhir sets off for a run even though the ball is in Dhoni's hands. Hilfenhaus collects the keeper's throw halfway down the pitch, runs back and underarms it to the stumps.
Hilfenhaus to Uthappa,2 runs
Hilfenhaus to Uthappa,no run
Hilfenhaus to Uthappa,1 run,pushed down to deep midwicket.
Hilfenhaus to Kallis,no run,Back of a length, tight on off stump, Kallis goes back and tries to cut, but doesn't have too much room, and he chops it straight to point.
Mohit Sharma now.
Sharma to Uthappa,no run,Flicked to square leg from middle stump.
Sharma to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,Comes down the track, gives himself room to slash it behind point.
Sharma to Uthappa, $$SIX$$ ,Short, outside off, sits up for Uthappa to pull it over the long-on boundary.
Good start from Uthappa, after a nervy first over against Hilfenhaus.
Sharma to Uthappa,1 run,Goes back to a fullish ball on middle stump to flick it to deep square leg.
Sharma to Kallis,no run,Kallis makes room, steers it straight to point.
Sharma to Kallis, $$FOUR$$ ,Shot! Down the track, takes a step away from the line, crunches it between cover and mid off.
Ashwin, from around the wicket.
Ashwin to Uthappa,1 run,Full toss, clipped down to long-on.
Ashwin to Kallis,no run,Kallis tries to make room again, and is beaten outside off as he tries to drive.
Ashwin to Kallis,no run,pushed back towards the bowler.
Ashwin to Kallis, $$OUT$$ ,Bad ball gets Kallis! Wide outside leg stump, and he sweeps uppishly, straight to deep backward square leg, one of two fielders on the leg-side boundary.
Chennai haven't bowled particularly well so far, but they have two important wickets. Manish Pandey is the new man.
Ashwin to Uthappa,1 run,Nearly gets another! Uthappa slog-sweeps, and Raina dives forward from deep midwicket, but the ball bounces just in front of him.
Ashwin to Pandey,1 run,length ball, on leg stump, worked into the leg side.
Spin from both ends. Jadeja now.
Jadeja to Pandey, $$OUT$$ ,and he gets a wicket first ball! Stops on Pandey outside off stump, and he checks his shot halfway into a drive, pops it straight into cover's hands.
Shakib bowled a good spell. Can he do it with the bat?
Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, $$OUT$$ ,No he can't! Slogs his first ball straight to deep midwicket, where Mohit Sharma takes a good catch diving forward and to his left. Ball was swirling quite a bit.
It's all happening here, and it's a little hard to keep track of. Jadeja is on a hat-trick, and Suryakumar Yadav is in, at the non-striker's end.
Jadeja to Uthappa,1 run,No hat trick. Uthappa comes forward, guides it square on the off side.
Jadeja to Yadav,no run,Ball stops on him from wide of off stump, and keeps a bit low, goes under the bat as he tries to cut.
Jadeja to Yadav,no run,quick and straight, defended towards mid off.
Jadeja to Yadav,no run,bit of turn from leg and middle. Defended carefully down the pitch.
Suresh Raina replaces Ashwin
Raina to Uthappa,no run,Turn from outside off, cut straight to point.
Raina to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,shot! Having hit the last ball straight to that fielder, Uthappa reverse-sweeps this one past point.
Raina to Uthappa,1 run,Tries a big heave across the line, squirts it behind square for one.
Raina to Yadav,no run,short midwicket is in place, and Yadav finds him as he tries to flick.
Raina to Yadav,3 runs,cheeky! Late cut, almost out of Dhoni's gloves, big chase for Jadeja from point.
Raina to Uthappa,2 runs,Down the track, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket.
Pandey to Yadav,2 runs
Pandey to Yadav,no run
Pandey to Yadav,2 leg byes,tries to slog-sweep, goes off his body towards third man, where Manhas makes a good diving stop.
Pandey to Yadav,1 run,pushed down to long-on.
Kolkata have slipped badly here. They were 36 for 1 not that long ago.
Pandey to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,Super shot! Uthappa is on the front foot, but he's still perfectly balanced to play the cut behind point.
Pandey to Uthappa,1 run,Worked towards midwicket.
Ash: "Ashwin n Jaddu just got wickets and they are out of attack???" We're back after the time-out, and Ashwin is back in the attack.
Ashwin to Uthappa,no run,Down the track, Ashwin bowls a carrom ball outside leg. Uthappa defends down the pitch.
Ashwin to Uthappa,1 run,outside leg again, paddled fine.
Ashwin to Yadav,1 run,very full, flicked off his toes to deep midwicket.
Ashwin to Uthappa,1 run,swept to deep square leg.
Ashwin to Yadav,1 run,carrom ball again, on off stump, Yadav makes room, clubs it down to long-off.
Ashwin to Uthappa,1 run,tries the reverse-sweep from outside leg, doesn't make a great connection, trickles down to mid-off.
Jadeja is back as well.
Jadeja to Uthappa,1 run,goes back, pushes it to the off-side sweeper, thinks about two but Yadav sends him back, with good reason. Mohit makes good ground and sends in a powerful throw.
Jadeja to Yadav,no run,beaten trying to sweep from outside off. Ball skidded through.

Jadeja to Yadav, $$OUT$$ ,Another skidder, another failed sweep, and the finger goes up for the lbw shout. The ball hits Yadav on the back thigh, and he might be a touch unlucky, because that hit him on a line a little bit outside off.
Yusuf Pathan now, at No. 7.
Jadeja to Pathan,1 run,worked away to deep midwicket for the walked single.
Jadeja to Uthappa,no run,Goes with the arm once more, Uthappa stretches forward to defend.
Jadeja to Uthappa,no run,Full, hits Uthappa on the toe as he tries to flick, loud appeal from Dhoni. Ball was headed comfortably down the leg side.
Ashwin to Pathan,no run,Offbreak, bit of turn from outside off, flicked to midwicket.
Ashwin to Pathan,1 run,Makes room to cut, in front of point.
Ashwin to Uthappa,1 run,short, pulled to deep midwicket.
Ashwin to Pathan,no run,goes back and across, Ashwin fires a quick offbreak on off stump, defended.
Ashwin to Pathan,no run,tries to cut, is beaten.
Ashwin to Pathan,1 run,worked to square leg off the pads.
Jadeja to Pathan,no run,Pushes forward to defend, no turn, but he's still beaten.
Jadeja to Pathan,1 run,pushed down the ground to long-off.
Jadeja to Uthappa,2 runs,top-edges the reverse-sweep, sends it ballooning over slip.
Jadeja to Uthappa,no run,tries to come down the track, Jadeja bowls it quicker, forces him to defend.
Jadeja to Uthappa,1 run,too full and fast to reverse-sweep, goes off the toe-end towards mid-off.
Jadeja to Pathan,1 run,heaved across the line to deep midwicket.
Shahir Salman: "@Ash, seems like Raina was a decoy. Get an economy over, increase pressure. If Yadav goes after him, he is the slowest and there was a chance of a wicket."
Ashwin to Pathan,no run,Full offbreak on off, and Yusuf defends to mid-on.
Ashwin to Pathan,no run,quickish ball on leg stump, and Yusuf is hit on the pads, too late on the sweep.
Ashwin to Pathan,no run,pushed down the ground, but still no single.
Ashwin to Pathan,no run,slow ball dangled outside off, heaves and misses.
Ashwin to Pathan, $$SIX$$ ,short ball. Pathan leans back and clubs it mightily over deep midwicket.
Ashwin to Pathan, $$FOUR$$ ,carrom ball outside leg, full, and Pathan sweeps it wide of short fine leg. Not the best ball to bowl with that fielder in the circle.
Jadeja to Uthappa,1 run,Quick, back of a length, Uthappa tries to pull, hits it down to long-on.
Jadeja to Pathan,2 runs,Clubs a length ball wide of long-on, who has a bit of running to do to his right to make the stop.
Jadeja to Pathan,1 run,driven down to long-on from outside off.

Jadeja to Uthappa, $$OUT$$ ,he's been missing the reverse-sweep for a while, and the shot gets Uthappa out now. Off his glove, into the forearm, and lobs in the air for Dhoni to pouch running a few steps to his right. Jadeja appeals like mad, and the umpire tells him to turn around. Uthappa had already started walking.

Good innings from Uthappa, but he slowed down once the spinners came on. It became difficult to score after that, though, with the pitch behaving oddly at times and Ashwin and Jadeja bowling well. Uthappa could have certainly used some support from the other end. Here's Andre Russell.
Jadeja to Russell,no run,Stretches forward to defend.
Jadeja to Russell,no run,Quicker ball, and Russell can only pat it back to the bowler. End of a top spell from Jadeja, on a pitch designed for his style of bowling.

"WOW! What AGGRESSIVE captaincy by Dhoni! He has bowled out Ashwin & Jadeja with 3 overs still left in the game. Kudos to him for going for the kill !!" Would he have done that if Kolkata had more wickets in hand? Who knows. Here's Mohit.
Sharma to Pathan,1 run,Slower ball, clubbed away to deep midwicket.
Sharma to Russell,no run,Another slower ball, outside off, heave and miss from Russell and the ball goes rolling down to Dhoni.
Sharma to Russell,1 run,Full-toss, swung down to long-on.
Sharma to Pathan,no run,Another one out of the back of his hand. It even turns a bit, away from Pathan, as he looks to heave it away to the leg side and misses.
Sharma to Pathan,1 run,Full, almost in the blockhole, tucked behind square on the leg side.
Sharma to Russell, $$OUT$$ ,Another slower-ball, another across-the-line heave, another batsman beaten. This time, it's straight, and it crashes into middle stump.
Two overs to go, 59 to get. It's still mathematically possible, folks. Hilfenhaus is in.
Hilfenhaus to Pathan, $$SIX$$ ,Big clean swing of those arms and the ball goes sailing over the midwicket boundary.
Hilfenhaus to Pathan, $$SIX$$ ,The bottom hand comes off the bat, but he still sends this length ball soaring over the ropes.
Hilfenhaus to Pathan,no run,Hilfy pulls his length back, short outside off, and beats Yusuf on the pull.
Hilfenhaus to Pathan,no run,wide yorker, testing the limits of the wide rule. Yusuf lets it go, but the umpire is unmoved.
Hilfenhaus to Pathan, $$SIX$$ ,Wide outside off again, gives Yusuf a lot of room to swing. He makes clean contact, and it goes way over long-on.
Hilfenhaus to Pathan,1 run,Full, just outside off. Yusuf swings hard, but can't get the elevation this time. Skids down to long-on.
40 off six balls. This is still mathematically possible, given a couple of no-balls. In comes Mohit, with that distinctive hop of his.
Sharma to Pathan,1 run,Full, straight, in the blockhole, hit down to long-on.
Here, meanwhile, is Piyush Chawla, on strike for the first time. Mohit to go around the wicket to the left-hander.
Sharma to Chawla,1 run,tries to chop it to point, gets an inside-edge that squirts into the leg side.
Sheikh Mudasir: "Dd they not tell Yousuf it is a 17 over game not 20?"
Sharma to Pathan,1 run,Short, rising ball outside off. Pathan top-edges the attempted pull, but it falls well short of deep square leg.
Sharma to Chawla, $$OUT$$ ,Full, wide outside off, and Chawla swings it straight down long-off's throat.
Sharma to Pathan, $$OUT$$ ,Full, angled in, lbw. Pathan looks to slog across the line, and misses. Hits him right in front of off stump. Plumb.
One ball, 57 to get. Mohit on a hat trick. Narine can't prevent defeat, but can he prevent the hat-trick?
Sharma to Narine,1 run,He can. It's a slower ball, angled into the left-hander from around the wicket, and he waits on it before dabbing it behind point.

So that's it from us for this game. Chennai were just too good for Kolkata once Brendon McCullum had laid them that platform. Kolkata's bowlers might feel they gave away too many, particularly on a pitch that had a lot of help in it for the spinners, and Ravindra Jadeja showed them that this was certainly the case when he came on and took four wickets that settled the contest for good. Chennai have made it five wins in six games, and Kolkata have two from six.
Thanks for tuning in, and sending in all your comments. This is Karthik Krishnaswamy, your commentator for the day, signing off.

Here's MS Dhoni, at the post-match presentation. He says he was worried about how the pitch might behave, but decided to bat first with the thought that it might slow down later. Chennai decided to keep the same combination, he added, because they had Dwayne Smith as a back-up seam option.
Ravindra Jadeja is the Man of the Match. He says he felt it would be a good day as soon as he bowled a few balls on this pitch.
chibi: "Both orange and purple has 2 superkings players in the top 3 ! That shows the team's strength."
Sohom: "KKR'S DOT BALL PERCENTAGE IS 47%, AND THEY NEED TO LOOK INTO THAT IF THEY ARE TO BE AT LEAST COMPETITIVE IN THE UPCOMING GAMES."
Mohit Sharma's three wickets, meanwhile, took him to 11 wickets, which means he's now in possession of the Purple Cap.

Gautam Gambhir says there have been a few good individual performances from Kolkata's players, but they haven't clicked as a team yet. "We won seven games in a row when we won the IPL," he says, and hopes they can go on a similar run. Uthappa, he adds, is likely to continue at the top of the order.

Big win here from Chennai, and it never looked in doubt after Jadeja came on and took two wickets in two balls. Robin Uthappa fought hard, but it was always going to be difficult when so many wickets were falling around him. Most of Chennai's bowlers bowled well, but that couldn't be said of Kolkata's bowlers, who bowled far too short to Brendon McCullum, and that in the end proved the biggest difference between the two sides.

name: Chennai Super Kings v Kolkata Knight Riders
